context.introduction: ¡Bienvenidos a la cocina mexicana! Discover the essential foundations of Mexican cuisine - from the vibrant world of salsas to traditional cooking tools that have shaped one of the world's most beloved culinary traditions.

sections.title: Salsas: The Heart of Mexican Cuisine
sections.content: Salsas are the soul of Mexican cooking, with tomatoes (jitomate and tomatillo) forming the base of most recipes. These versatile sauces combine fresh or roasted tomatoes with chiles, onions, garlic, and herbs to create countless regional variations. Each salsa tells the story of its region and family traditions.

sections.title: Chile Poblano: The Gentle Giant
sections.content: The poblano chile is perfect for beginners, offering rich, earthy flavors with mild to moderate heat (1,000-2,000 Scoville units). When fresh, it's ideal for chiles rellenos and rajas. When dried, it becomes the chile ancho, essential for complex moles and sophisticated sauces.

sections.title: Masa de Maíz: Ancient Grain, Modern Kitchen
sections.content: Corn masa is created through nixtamalización - an ancient Mesoamerican process where corn is cooked with lime (cal). This process improves nutritional value, flavor, and workability. Fresh masa creates the perfect tortillas, tamales, and countless antojitos that define Mexican street food.

sections.title: El Comal: The Essential Griddle
listItems: Traditional comals are made from clay, cast iron, or carbon steel
Used for cooking tortillas, toasting spices, and charring vegetables
A well-seasoned comal develops a natural non-stick surface
Heat gradually to prevent cracking (especially clay comals)
The comal imparts a distinctive smoky flavor to ingredients

sections.title: Fundamental Techniques
listItems: Char tomatoes and tomatillos directly on the comal for deeper flavor
Toast dried chiles briefly to awaken their oils - don't burn them
Fresh masa should feel smooth and pliable, never sticky or dry
Season your comal with a light coating of oil and heat gradually
Practice the 'tortilla flip' - confidence is key to perfect tortillas
